skill.name: venue-templates
skill.description: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major scientific publication venues (Nature, Science, PLOS, IEEE, ACM), academic conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI), research posters, and grant proposals (NSF, NIH, DOE, DARPA). This skill should be used when preparing manuscripts for journal submission, conference papers, research posters, or grant proposals and need venue-specific formatting requirements and templates.
skill.summary: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major s...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and template management skill with no code execution risks. Scripts only read/write within their own directory using standard Python libraries. No network access, no credential access, no external command injection vectors.

content.user_title: Format papers for journals and conferences
content.value_statement: Preparing manuscripts for journal submission or conference deadlines requires precise formatting that varies by venue. This skill provides ready-to-use LaTeX templates and detailed requirements for over 50 scientific venues including Nature, NeurIPS, NSF, and NIH.
actual_capabilities: Access LaTeX templates for 50+ journals and conferences
Check formatting requirements by venue (pages, fonts, margins)
Customize templates with author and project information
Generate formatted documents for journals, posters, and grants
limitations: Does not compile LaTeX or validate PDF output
Does not provide submission system integration
Templates should be verified against current official guidelines
Does not generate content or write manuscript sections

use_cases.title: Format conference papers
use_cases.description: Prepare NeurIPS or ICML submissions with correct page limits, citation styles, and anonymization requirements.

use_cases.title: Draft journal manuscripts
use_cases.description: Create Nature or Science articles with proper structure, figure guidelines, and reference formatting.

use_cases.title: Prepare grant proposals
use_cases.description: Format NSF and NIH proposals with correct page limits, sections, and review criteria compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Find template
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to submit a paper to Nature. What are the formatting requirements and do you have a LaTeX template?

prompt_templates.title: Check requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the page limits, font requirements, and citation style for NeurIPS 2025 submissions?

prompt_templates.title: Customize template
prompt_templates.prompt: Customize the NSF proposal template with my research on machine learning for climate science.

prompt_templates.title: Create poster
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me poster templates and guidelines for creating an A0 academic poster for ISMB conference.

output_examples.input: I need to prepare a manuscript for Nature journal
output: â€¢ Format: Single column for submission, 12pt font
â€¢ Figures: 300-600 dpi, TIFF or EPS format
â€¢ LaTeX template available at assets/journals/nature_article.tex

best_practices: Always verify templates against the current official author guidelines before submission
Use the customize_template.py script to efficiently fill in author and project details
Check page limits and formatting requirements early in your writing process
anti_patterns: Using outdated templates without checking current year requirements
Ignoring venue-specific anonymization rules for double-blind review
Assuming one template works for all venues in the same publisher family

faq.question: Which journals and conferences are supported?
faq.answer: Supports 50+ venues including Nature, Science, PLOS, IEEE, ACM, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI, and major publishers.

faq.question: Are templates compatible with Overleaf?
faq.answer: Yes. All LaTeX templates use standard classes and packages compatible with Overleaf and local LaTeX installations.

faq.question: Does this skill compile LaTeX?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides templates and guidance. You will need to compile using pdflatex, Overleaf, or your preferred LaTeX editor.

faq.question: How often are templates updated?
faq.answer: Templates are updated annually. Always verify against the current year author guidelines before submission.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads template files within its own directory. No data is sent anywhere or stored externally.

faq.question: How is this different from official templates?
faq.answer: This skill consolidates multiple venue requirements for quick reference. Always use official templates from venues for final submissions.
